abstract: In this paper, we present a greedy algorithm based on a tensor product decomposition, whose aim is to compute the global minimum of a strongly convex energy functional. We prove the convergence of our method provided that the gradient of the energy is Lipschitz on bounded sets. The main interest of this method is that it can be used for high-dimensional nonlinear convex problems. We illustrate this method on a prototypical example for uncertainty propagation on the obstacle problem.
